text.p: Finnish engineering group Santasalo-JOT Oy said on Friday it expected its full-year earnings to be higher than in 1996, when it posted a 37.9 million markka profit after financial items and 3.75 markka EPS.

"Santasalo-JOT group net sales are expected to rise this year to almost 1.3 billion markka and the result to improve on last year," Santasalo said in a statement with its January-April earnings report.
Its 1996 net sales totalled 846 million markka.
January-April profit after financial items was flat at 14 million markka and earnings per share rose to 1.46 markka from 1.23 markka in the year-ago period, the group said.

Santasalo-JOT said it expected heavy transport vehicle demand to strengthen from the start of the year and machinery industry markets would stay strong, and a positive trend in the construction industry would continue.
"Wood processing industry machinery and equipment orders are expected to increase clearly towards the end of the year," it added. -- Helsinki Newsroom +358-9-680 50 242, news@reuters.fi
